title: AB 1673
content: The people of the State of California enact the following. Section 16520 of the Penal Code is amended to define a "firearm" as a device designed for weapon use that expels a projectile through a barrel by explosion or combustion. The definition includes the frame or receiver of the weapon in various sections of the code. The Penal Code defines a "firearm" as a device that expels a projectile through a barrel by explosion or combustion. Various sections of the code include specific definitions and exclusions for firearms, such as rocket launchers and antique firearms. The Penal Code provides specific definitions and exclusions for firearms in various sections, including definitions for firearms in Sections 34005, 34010, 17280, 24680, and 29010 to 29150. The definition of a firearm excludes destructive devices in Sections 34005 and 34010, aligns with Section 922 of Title 18 of the United States Code in Sections 17280 and 24680, and includes unfinished frames or receivers that can be converted to functional firearms in Sections 29010 to 29150. In Sections 29010 to 29150, "firearm" includes unfinished frames or receivers that can be converted to functional weapons. The Penal Code defines a firearm as a device designed to expel a projectile through a barrel by explosion or combustion. The definition of "firearm" in the Penal Code includes various sections that encompass frames, receivers, rockets, and explosive devices. The Penal Code defines "firearm" in various sections, excluding unloaded antique firearms in specific provisions. Additionally, in other sections, the definition of "firearm" excludes destructive devices or aligns with Section 922 of Title 18 of the United States Code. The Penal Code defines "firearm" in different sections, excluding certain types of weapons. It also aligns with Section 922 of Title 18 of the United States Code in some cases. The definition of "firearm" includes unfinished frames or receivers that can be easily converted into functional weapons. Section 16520 of the Penal Code is amended to define "firearm" as a device designed for weapon use that expels a projectile through a barrel by explosion or combustion. This definition includes the frame or receiver of the weapon in various sections listed. The Penal Code defines "firearm" as a device that expels a projectile through a barrel by explosion or combustion. It includes various sections detailing the definition, including specific provisions for rocket launchers and antique firearms. The Penal Code includes sections specifying the definition of a firearm, such as Chapter 6 and Chapter 7 of Division 5 of Title 4, along with various other sections detailing different aspects of firearms. The term "firearm" is defined differently in various sections, including exclusions for destructive devices and unfinished frames or receivers that can be converted into functional firearms. In Sections 29010 to 29150, "firearm" includes unfinished frames or receivers that can be converted to functional condition. A "frame" or "receiver" houses the firing mechanism and can be further machined to be part of a functional weapon. Section 16520 of the Penal Code defines a "firearm" as a device designed to expel a projectile through a barrel by combustion. This definition applies to various sections including 16550, 16730, 16960, 16990, 17070, and 17310. In the following sections, "firearm" includes frames or receivers as defined in subdivision (h) of the Penal Code. This definition applies to various sections such as 16550, 16730, 16960, 16990, 17070, and 17310, among others. Additionally, in specific provisions, "firearm" also encompasses rockets, rocket propelled projectile launchers, or similar devices containing explosive or incendiary material, as outlined in sections 16750, 16840(b), 25400, and 25850 to 26025. In the specified sections, a "firearm" excludes unloaded antique firearms as defined in sections 16730(a) and (c), 16550, 16960, 17310, and other related provisions. Additionally, in sections 34005 and 34010, a "firearm" does not include destructive devices, while in sections 17280 and 24680, the term aligns with Section 922 of Title 18 of the United States Code. In sections 29010 to 29150, "firearm" includes unfinished frames or receivers that can be easily converted to functional weapons. The terms "frame" and "receiver" refer to parts of a firearm housing essential components and designed exclusively for use in functional weapons. Section 2 of the bill outlines conditions for the incorporation of amendments to Section 16520 of the Penal Code from multiple bills, specifying when these changes will become operative. Section 1.3 of the bill incorporates amendments to Section 16520 of the Penal Code from multiple bills, specifying conditions for when these changes will become operative. No reimbursement is required by this act as it may incur costs for local agencies or school districts due to creating new crimes or infractions, eliminating existing ones, or changing penalties.
